data.meaning: to make yourself seem to be less important or to not deserve respect

data.meaning: to make a word or phrase shorter by using only the first letters of each word

data.meaning: to keep delaying something that must be done, often because it is unpleasant or boring

data.meaning: to make something or bring something into existence

data.meaning: something that is made to be sold, usually something that is produced by an industrial process or, less commonly, something that is grown or obtained through farming
data.example: They do a range of skin-care products.

data.meaning: any type of work that needs special training or a particular skill, often one that is respected because it involves a high level of education

data.meaning: relating to work that needs special training or education
data.example: Chris, you're a nurse, so can I ask your professional opinion on bandaging ankles?

data.meaning: a teacher of the highest rank in a department of a British university, or a teacher of high rank in an American university or college

data.meaning: skilled and experienced

data.meaning: a short description of someone's life, work, character, etc.

data.meaning: money that is earned in trade or business after paying the costs of producing and selling goods and services

data.meaning: felt or experienced very strongly or in an extreme way

data.meaning: to give a judgment about what is likely to happen in the future, especially in connection with a particular situation

data.meaning: a series of instructions that can be put into a computer in order to make it perform an operation

data.meaning: movement to an improved or more developed state, or to a forward position

data.meaning: a calculation or guess about the future based on information that you have

data.meaning: a member of the proletariat

data.meaning: very well known and important

data.meaning: (of a person) having a lot of different sexual partners or sexual relationships, or (of sexual habits) involving a lot of different partners

data.meaning: to tell someone that you will certainly do something

data.meaning: activities to advertise something

data.meaning: to make something happen

data.meaning: a fact or piece of information that shows that something exists or is true

data.meaning: the fact that someone is likely to behave in a particular way, especially a bad way

data.meaning: an object or objects that belong to someone

data.meaning: correct moral behaviour or actions

data.meaning: to try to persuade someone to do something or give you something by praising them or being intentionally charming

data.meaning: compared with the fact that; but

data.meaning: to increase someone's interest in and wish for something, usually by giving them a small experience of it

data.meaning: during the time that, or at the same time as

data.meaning: unusual and strange in a way that might be funny or annoying

data.meaning: of a colour like that of snow, milk, or bone

data.meaning: the woman that you are married to

data.meaning: someone who wins a game, competition, or election

data.meaning: the season between autumn and spring, lasting from November to March north of the equator and from May to September south of the equator, when the weather is coldest

data.meaning: used with the past simple to express that you feel sorry or sad about a state or situation that exists at the moment

data.meaning: a person who sees an event happening, especially a crime or an accident

data.meaning: a single unit of language that has meaning and can be spoken or written
